thread.title: Nintendo Can Make Money on Your Super Mario Maker Levels?
thread.title_full: Nintendo Can Make Money on Your Super Mario Maker Levels?

title: Nintendo Can Make Money on Your Super Mario Maker Levels?
text:
Get Business & Technology Alerts 
14 Sep 2015 01:19 AM EST 
Super Mario Maker is a fun way to try your hand at level design without having to code. It also allows you the opportunity to feel the stabbing disappointment of hours spent crafting the perfect level, only to see it unappreciated and deleted from Nintendo’s servers. Not too long ago, Ben Kuchera hit on an interesting experience Super Mario Maker provides to the masses — an idea of what it’s like to be an indie developer, but there are some distinct differences. Unlike releasing your level online under your own name, Nintendo might just take your idea as their own. Rocket News 24’s Casey Baseel reports creators are being met with an unsettling disclaimer before they share their custom levels. It reads: "Nintendo reserves the right to use uploaded courses and related data, either as-is or with alterations, for either commercial or noncommercial purposes without compensation to the uploader."
